sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Old State Capitol Act.

sections.heading: The Department shall have jurisdiction and custody of, and shall
sections.text:
maintain and operate, the Old State Capitol Complex and shall succeed to
all rights, powers, duties and liabilities of the Department of
Conservation under the "1961 Act" or under any lease or contract relating
to the Old State Capitol Complex to which the Department of Conservation is
a party.

sections.heading: The Department may establish rules and regulations for the use
sections.text:
and operation of the Old State Capitol Complex. Such rules and regulations
shall provide that such complex will be open at all reasonable hours to the
public and may provide for the holding of such lectures, pageants or
similar special events and the sale of such merchandise as will help
interpret the historical significance of the Old State Capitol to the
public.

sections.heading: Upon the expiration of the term of any existing lease to which the
sections.text:
Department of Conservation is a party, the Board of Trustees may enter into
a lease, on behalf of the State of Illinois, of the underground parking
garage in the Old State Capitol Complex.
